alert.note: Alert for Culebra (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 17 at 4:50PM AST until December 20 at 6:00AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 PM AST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of up to 10 to 15 feet. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Beaches of the northern U.S. Virgin Islands and Culebra. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Saturday to 6 PM AST Sunday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
